013package org.apache.juneau.microservice;
014
015import static org.apache.juneau.common.utils.IOUtils.*;
016import static org.apache.juneau.common.utils.Utils.*;
017import static org.apache.juneau.internal.ClassUtils.*;
018import static org.apache.juneau.internal.CollectionUtils.*;
019import static org.apache.juneau.internal.FileUtils.*;
020
021import java.io.*;
022import java.io.Console;
023import java.net.*;
024import java.nio.file.*;
025import java.text.*;
026import java.util.*;
027import java.util.concurrent.*;
028import java.util.jar.*;
029import java.util.logging.*;
030import java.util.logging.Formatter;
031
032import org.apache.juneau.*;
033import org.apache.juneau.collections.*;
034import org.apache.juneau.common.utils.*;
035import org.apache.juneau.config.*;
036import org.apache.juneau.config.event.*;
037import org.apache.juneau.config.store.*;
038import org.apache.juneau.config.store.FileStore;
039import org.apache.juneau.config.vars.*;
040import org.apache.juneau.cp.*;
041import org.apache.juneau.microservice.console.*;
042import org.apache.juneau.microservice.resources.*;
043import org.apache.juneau.parser.ParseException;
044import org.apache.juneau.svl.*;
045import org.apache.juneau.svl.vars.*;
046import org.apache.juneau.utils.*;
047
048/**
049 * Parent class for all microservices.
050 *
051 * <p>
052 * A microservice defines a simple API for starting and stopping simple Java services contained in executable jars.
053 *
054 * <p>
055 * The general command for creating and starting a microservice from a main method is as follows:
056 * <p class='bjava'>
057 *    <jk>public static void</jk> main(String[] <jv>args</jv>) {
058 *       Microservice.<jsm>create</jsm>().args(<jv>args</jv>).build().start().join();
059 *  }
060 * </p>
061 *
062 * <p>
063 * Your microservice class must be specified as the <jk>Main-Class</jk> entry in the manifest file of your microservice
064 * jar file if it's an executable jar.
065 *
066 * <h5 class='topic'>Microservice Configuration</h5>
067 *
068 * This class defines the following method for accessing configuration for your microservice:
069 * <ul class='spaced-list'>
070 *    <li>
071 *       {@link #getArgs()} - The command-line arguments passed to the jar file.
072 *    <li>
073 *       {@link #getConfig()} - An external INI-style configuration file.
074 *    <li>
075 *       {@link #getManifest()} - The manifest file for the main jar file.
076 * </ul>
077 *
078 * <h5 class='topic'>Lifecycle Methods</h5>
079 *
080 * Subclasses must implement the following lifecycle methods:
081 * <ul class='spaced-list'>
082 *    <li>
083 *       {@link #init()} - Gets executed immediately following construction.
084 *    <li>
085 *       {@link #start()} - Gets executed during startup.
086 *    <li>
087 *       {@link #stop()} - Gets executed when 'exit' is typed in the console or an external shutdown signal is received.
088 *    <li>
089 *       {@link #kill()} - Can be used to forcibly shut down the service.  Doesn't get called during normal operation.
090 * </ul>
091 *
092 * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
093 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://juneau.apache.org/docs/topics/JuneauMicroserviceCoreBasics">juneau-microservice-core Basics</a>
094
095 * </ul>
096 */
097public class Microservice implements ConfigEventListener {
098
099   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
100   // Static
101   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
102
103   private static volatile Microservice INSTANCE;
104
105   private static void setInstance(Microservice m) {
106      synchronized(Microservice.class) {
107         INSTANCE = m;
108      }
109   }
110
111   /**
112    * Returns the Microservice instance.
113    *
114    * <p>
115    * This method only works if there's only one Microservice instance in a JVM.
116    * Otherwise, it's just overwritten by the last instantiated microservice.
117    *
118    * @return The Microservice instance, or <jk>null</jk> if there isn't one.
119    */
120   public static Microservice getInstance() {
121      synchronized(Microservice.class) {
122         return INSTANCE;
123      }
124   }
125
126   /**
127    * Creates a new builder for this object.
128    *
129    * @return A new microservice builder.
130    */
131   public static Builder create() {
132      return new Builder();
133   }
134
135   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
136   // Builder
137   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
138
139   /**
140    * Builder class.
141    */
142   public static class Builder {
143
144      Args args;
145      ManifestFile manifest;
146      Logger logger;
147      LogConfig logConfig;
148      Config config;
149      String configName;
150      ConfigStore configStore;
151      Config.Builder configBuilder = Config.create();
152      Boolean consoleEnabled;
153      List<ConsoleCommand> consoleCommands = list();
154      VarResolver.Builder varResolver = VarResolver.create().defaultVars().vars(ConfigVar.class);
155      Scanner consoleReader;
156      PrintWriter consoleWriter;
157      MicroserviceListener listener;
158      File workingDir = System.getProperty("juneau.workingDir") == null ? null : new File(System.getProperty("juneau.workingDir"));
159
160      /**
161       * Constructor.
162       */
163      protected Builder() {}
164
165      /**
166       * Copy constructor.
167       *
168       * @param copyFrom The builder to copy.
169       */
170      protected Builder(Builder copyFrom) {
171         this.args = copyFrom.args;
172         this.manifest = copyFrom.manifest;
173         this.logger = copyFrom.logger;
174         this.configName = copyFrom.configName;
175         this.logConfig = copyFrom.logConfig == null ? null : copyFrom.logConfig.copy();
176         this.consoleEnabled = copyFrom.consoleEnabled;
177         this.configBuilder = copyFrom.configBuilder;
178         this.varResolver = copyFrom.varResolver;
179         this.consoleReader = copyFrom.consoleReader;
180         this.consoleWriter = copyFrom.consoleWriter;
181         this.workingDir = copyFrom.workingDir;
182      }
183
184      /**
185       * Creates a copy of this builder.
186       *
187       * @return A new copy of this builder.
188       */
189      public Builder copy() {
190         return new Builder(this);
191      }
192
193      /**
194       * Instantiate a new microservice using the settings defined on this builder.
195       *
196       * @return A new microservice.
197       * @throws Exception Error occurred.
198       */
199      public Microservice build() throws Exception {
200         return new Microservice(this);
201      }
202
203      /**
204       * Specifies the command-line arguments passed into the Java command.
205       *
206       * <p>
207       * This is required if you use {@link Microservice#getArgs()} or <c>$A</c> string variables.
208       *
209       * @param args
210       *    The command-line arguments passed into the Java command as a pre-parsed {@link Args} object.
211       * @return This object.
212       */
213      public Builder args(Args args) {
214         this.args = args;
215         return this;
216      }
217
218      /**
219       * Specifies the command-line arguments passed into the Java command.
220       *
221       * <p>
222       * This is required if you use {@link Microservice#getArgs()} or <c>$A</c> string variables.
223       *
224       * @param args
225       *    The command-line arguments passed into the Java command as the raw command-line arguments.
226       * @return This object.
227       */
228      public Builder args(String...args) {
229         this.args = new Args(args);
230         return this;
231      }
232
233      /**
234       * Specifies the manifest file of the jar file this microservice is contained within.
235       *
236       * <p>
237       * This is required if you use {@link Microservice#getManifest()}.
238       * It's also used to locate initialization values such as <c>Main-Config</c>.
239       *
240       * <p>
241       * If you do not specify the manifest file, we attempt to resolve it through the following methods:
242       * <ol class='spaced-list'>
243       *    <li>
244       *       Looking on the file system for a file at <js>"META-INF/MANIFEST.MF"</js>.
245       *       This is primarily to allow for running microservices from within eclipse workspaces where the manifest file
246       *       is located in the project root.
247       *    <li>
248       *       Using the class loader for this class to find the file at the URL <js>"META-INF/MANIFEST.MF"</js>.
249       * </ol>
250       *
251       * @param value
252       *    The manifest file of this microservice.
253       *    <br>Can be any of the following types:
254       *    <ul>
255       *       <li>{@link ManifestFile}
256       *       <li>{@link Manifest}
257       *       <li>{@link Reader} - Containing the raw contents of the manifest.  Note that the input must end with a newline.
258       *       <li>{@link InputStream} - Containing the raw contents of the manifest.  Note that the input must end with a newline.
259       *       <li>{@link File} - File containing the raw contents of the manifest.
260       *       <li>{@link String} - Path to file containing the raw contents of the manifest.
261       *       <li>{@link Class} - Finds and loads the manifest file of the jar file that the specified class is contained within.
262       *    </ul>
263       * @return This object.
264       * @throws IOException Thrown by underlying stream.
265       */
266        public Builder manifest(Object value) throws IOException {
267            if (value == null)
268                this.manifest = null;
269            else if (value instanceof ManifestFile manifestFile)
270                this.manifest = manifestFile;
271            else if (value instanceof Manifest manifest)
272                this.manifest = new ManifestFile(manifest);
273            else if (value instanceof Reader reader)
274                this.manifest = new ManifestFile(reader);
275            else if (value instanceof InputStream inputStream)
276                this.manifest = new ManifestFile(inputStream);
277            else if (value instanceof File file)
278                this.manifest = new ManifestFile(file);
279            else if (value instanceof Path path)
280                this.manifest = new ManifestFile(path);
281            else if (value instanceof String string)
282                this.manifest = new ManifestFile(resolveFile(string));
283            else if (value instanceof Class clazz)
284                this.manifest = new ManifestFile(clazz);
285            else
286                throw new BasicRuntimeException("Invalid type passed to Builder.manifest(Object).  Type=[{0}]", className(value));
287
288            return this;
289        }
290
291      /**
292       * Specifies the logger used by the microservice and returned by the {@link Microservice#getLogger()} method.
293       *
294       * <p>
295       * Calling this method overrides the default logging mechanism controlled by the {@link #logConfig(LogConfig)} method.
296       *
297       * @param logger The logger to use for logging microservice messages.
298       * @return This object.
299       */
300      public Builder logger(Logger logger) {
301         this.logger = logger;
302         return this;
303      }
304
305      /**
306       * Specifies logging instructions for the microservice.
307       *
308       * <p>
309       * If not specified, the values are taken from the <js>"Logging"</js> section of the configuration.
310       *
311       * <p>
312       * This method is ignored if {@link #logger(Logger)} is used to set the microservice logger.
313       *
314       * @param logConfig The log configuration.
315       * @return This object.
316       */
317      public Builder logConfig(LogConfig logConfig) {
318         this.logConfig = logConfig;
319         return this;
320      }
321
322      /**
323       * Specifies the config for initializing this microservice.
324       *
325       * <p>
326       * Calling this method overrides the default configuration controlled by the {@link #configName(String)} and {@link #configStore(ConfigStore)} methods.
327       *
328       * @param config The configuration.
329       * @return This object.
330       */
331      public Builder config(Config config) {
332         this.config = config;
333         return this;
334      }
335
336      /**
337       * Specifies the config name for initializing this microservice.
338       *
339       * <p>
340       * If you do not specify the config file location, we attempt to resolve it through the following methods:
341       * <ol class='spaced-list'>
342       *    <li>
343       *       Resolve file first in working directory, then in classpath, using the following names:
344       *       <ul>
345       *          <li>
346       *             The <js>"configFile"</js> argument in the command line arguments passed in through the constructor.
347       *          <li>
348       *             The value of the <c>Main-Config</c> entry in the manifest file.
349       *          <li>
350       *             A config file in the same location and with the same name as the executable jar file.
351       *             (e.g. <js>"java -jar myjar.jar"</js> will look for <js>"myjar.cfg"</js>).
352       *       </ul>
353       *    <li>
354       *       Resolve any <js>"*.cfg"</js> file that can be found in the working directory.
355       *    <li>
356       *       Resolve any of the following files in the classpath:  <js>"juneau.cfg"</js>, <js>"system.cfg"</js>
357       * </ol>
358       *
359       * <p>
360       * If no configuration file is found, and empty in-memory configuration is used.
361       *
362       * @param configName The configuration name.
363       * @return This object.
364       */
365      public Builder configName(String configName) {
366         this.configName = configName;
367         return this;
368      }
369
370      /**
371       * Specifies the config store to use for storing and retrieving configurations.
372       *
373       * <p>
374       * By default, we use a {@link FileStore} store for configuration files.
375       *
376       * @param configStore The configuration name.
377       * @return This object.
378       */
379      public Builder configStore(ConfigStore configStore) {
380         this.configStore = configStore;
381         return this;
382      }
383
384      /**
385       * Specifies that the Java console is enabled for this microservice.
386       *
387       * <p>
388       * If not specified, this value is taken from the <js>"Console/enabled"</js> configuration setting.
389       * If not specified in the configuration, defaults to <jk>false</jk>.
390       *
391       * @param consoleEnabled <jk>true</jk> if the Java console is enabled for this microservice.
392       * @return This object.
393       */
394      public Builder consoleEnabled(boolean consoleEnabled) {
395         this.consoleEnabled = consoleEnabled;
396         return this;
397      }
398
399      /**
400       * Specifies console commands to make available on the Java console.
401       *
402       * <p>
403       * Note that these are ignored if the console is not enabled via {@link #consoleEnabled(boolean)}.
404       *
405       * <p>
406       * This list augments the commands defined via the <js>"Console/commands"</js> configuration setting.
407       *
408       * <p>
409       * This method can only be used on console commands with no-arg constructors.
410       *
411       * @param consoleCommands The list of console commands to append to the list of available commands.
412       * @return This object.
413       * @throws ExecutableException Exception occurred on invoked constructor/method/field.
414       */
415      @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
416      public Builder consoleCommands(Class<? extends ConsoleCommand>...consoleCommands) throws ExecutableException {
417         try {
418            for (Class<? extends ConsoleCommand> cc : consoleCommands)
419               this.consoleCommands.add(cc.getDeclaredConstructor().newInstance());
420         } catch (Exception e) {
421            throw new ExecutableException(e);
422         }
423         return this;
424      }
425
426      /**
427       * Specifies console commands to make available on the Java console.
428       *
429       * <p>
430       * Note that these are ignored if the console is not enabled via {@link #consoleEnabled(boolean)}.
431       *
432       * <p>
433       * This list augments the commands defined via the <js>"Console/commands"</js> configuration setting.
434       *
435       * @param consoleCommands The list of console commands to append to the list of available commands.
436       * @return This object.
437       */
438      public Builder consoleCommands(ConsoleCommand...consoleCommands) {
439         addAll(this.consoleCommands, consoleCommands);
440         return this;
441      }
442
443      /**
444       * Specifies the console input and output.
445       *
446       * <p>
447       * If not specified, uses the console returned by {@link System#console()}.
448       * If that is not available, uses {@link System#in} and {@link System#out}.
449       *
450       * <p>
451       * Note that these are ignored if the console is not enabled via {@link #consoleEnabled(boolean)}.
452       *
453       * @param consoleReader The console input.
454       * @param consoleWriter The console output.
455       * @return This object.
456       */
457      public Builder console(Scanner consoleReader, PrintWriter consoleWriter) {
458         this.consoleReader = consoleReader;
459         this.consoleWriter = consoleWriter;
460         return this;
461      }
462
463      /**
464       * Augments the set of variables defined in the configuration and var resolver.
465       *
466       * <p>
467       * This calls {@link org.apache.juneau.svl.VarResolver.Builder#vars(Class[])} on the var resolver used to construct the configuration
468       * object returned by {@link Microservice#getConfig()} and the var resolver returned by {@link Microservice#getVarResolver()}.
469       *
470       * @param vars The set of variables to append to the var resolver builder.
471       * @return This object.
472       */
473      @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
474      public Builder vars(Class<? extends Var>...vars) {
475         varResolver.vars(vars);
476         return this;
477      }
478
479      /**
480       * Adds a bean for vars defined in the var resolver.
481       *
482       * <p>
483       * This calls {@link org.apache.juneau.svl.VarResolver.Builder#bean(Class,Object)} on the var resolver used to construct the configuration
484       * object returned by {@link Microservice#getConfig()} and the var resolver returned by {@link Microservice#getVarResolver()}.
485       *
486       * @param c The bean type.
487       * @param value The bean.
488       * @param <T> The bean type.
489       * @return This object.
490       */
491      public <T> Builder varBean(Class<T> c, T value) {
492         varResolver.bean(c, value);
493         return this;
494      }
495
496      /**
497       * Specifies the directory to use to resolve the config file and other paths defined with the config file.
498       *
499       * @param workingDir The working directory, or <jk>null</jk> to use the underlying working directory.
500       * @return This object.
501       */
502      public Builder workingDir(File workingDir) {
503         this.workingDir = workingDir;
504         return this;
505      }
506
507      /**
508       * Specifies the directory to use to resolve the config file and other paths defined with the config file.
509       *
510       * @param workingDir The working directory, or <jk>null</jk> to use the underlying working directory.
511       * @return This object.
512       */
513      public Builder workingDir(String workingDir) {
514         this.workingDir = new File(workingDir);
515         return this;
516      }
517
518      /**
519       * Registers an event listener for this microservice.
520       *
521       * @param listener An event listener for this microservice.
522       * @return This object.
523       */
524      public Builder listener(MicroserviceListener listener) {
525         this.listener = listener;
526         return this;
527      }
528
529      /**
530       * Resolves the specified path.
531       *
532       * <p>
533       * If the working directory has been explicitly specified, relative paths are resolved relative to that.
534       *
535       * @param path The path to resolve.
536       * @return The resolved file.
537       */
538      protected File resolveFile(String path) {
539         if (Paths.get(path).isAbsolute())
540            return new File(path);
541         if (workingDir != null)
542            return new File(workingDir, path);
543         return new File(path);
544      }
545   }
546
547   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
548   // Instance
549   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
550
551   final Messages messages = Messages.of(Microservice.class);
552
553   private final Builder builder;
554   private final Args args;
555   private final Config config;
556   private final ManifestFile manifest;
557   private final VarResolver varResolver;
558   private final MicroserviceListener listener;
559   private final Map<String,ConsoleCommand> consoleCommandMap = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
560   private final boolean consoleEnabled;
561   private final Scanner consoleReader;
562   private final PrintWriter consoleWriter;
563   private final Thread consoleThread;
564   final File workingDir;
565   private final String configName;
566
567   private volatile Logger logger;
568
569   /**
570    * Constructor.
571    *
572    * @param builder The builder containing the settings for this microservice.
573    * @throws IOException Problem occurred reading file.
574    * @throws ParseException Malformed input encountered.
575    */
576   @SuppressWarnings("resource")
577   protected Microservice(Builder builder) throws IOException, ParseException {
578      setInstance(this);
579      this.builder = builder.copy();
580      this.workingDir = builder.workingDir;
581      this.configName = builder.configName;
582
583      this.args = builder.args != null ? builder.args : new Args(new String[0]);
584
585      // --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
586      // Try to get the manifest file if it wasn't already set.
587      // --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
588      ManifestFile manifest = builder.manifest;
589      if (manifest == null) {
590         Manifest m = new Manifest();
591
592         // If running within an eclipse workspace, need to get it from the file system.
593         File f = resolveFile("META-INF/MANIFEST.MF");
594         if (f.exists() && f.canRead()) {
595            try (FileInputStream fis = new FileInputStream(f)) {
596               m.read(fis);
597            } catch (IOException e) {
598               throw new IOException("Problem detected in MANIFEST.MF.  Contents below:\n"+read(f), e);
599            }
600         } else {
601            // Otherwise, read from manifest file in the jar file containing the main class.
602            URL url = getClass().getResource("META-INF/MANIFEST.MF");
603            if (url != null) {
604               try {
605                  m.read(url.openStream());
606               } catch (IOException e) {
607                  throw new IOException("Problem detected in MANIFEST.MF.  Contents below:\n"+read(url.openStream()), e);
608               }
609            }
610         }
611         manifest = new ManifestFile(m);
612      }
613      ManifestFileVar.init(manifest);
614      this.manifest = manifest;
615
616      // --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
617      // Try to resolve the configuration if not specified.
618      // --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
619      Config config = builder.config;
620      Config.Builder configBuilder = builder.configBuilder.varResolver(builder.varResolver.build()).store(MemoryStore.DEFAULT);
621      if (config == null) {
622         ConfigStore store = builder.configStore;
623         FileStore cfs = workingDir == null ? FileStore.DEFAULT : FileStore.create().directory(workingDir).build();
624         for (String name : getCandidateConfigNames()) {
625             if (store != null) {
626                if (store.exists(name)) {
627                   configBuilder.store(store).name(name);
628                   break;
629                }
630             } else {
631                if (cfs.exists(name)) {
632                   configBuilder.store(cfs).name(name);
633                   break;
634                }
635                if (ClasspathStore.DEFAULT.exists(name)) {
636                   configBuilder.store(ClasspathStore.DEFAULT).name(name);
637                   break;
638                }
639             }
640         }
641         config = configBuilder.build();
642      }
643      this.config = config;
644      Config.setSystemDefault(this.config);
645      this.config.addListener(this);
646
647      //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
648      // Var resolver.
649      //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
650      this.varResolver = builder.varResolver.bean(Config.class, config).build();
651
652      // --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
653      // Initialize console commands.
654      // --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
655      this.consoleEnabled = Utils.firstNonNull(builder.consoleEnabled, config.get("Console/enabled").asBoolean().orElse(false));
656      if (consoleEnabled) {
657         Console c = System.console();
658         this.consoleReader = Utils.firstNonNull(builder.consoleReader, new Scanner(c == null ? new InputStreamReader(System.in) : c.reader()));
659         this.consoleWriter = Utils.firstNonNull(builder.consoleWriter, c == null ? new PrintWriter(System.out, true) : c.writer());
660
661         for (ConsoleCommand cc : builder.consoleCommands) {
662            consoleCommandMap.put(cc.getName(), cc);
663         }
664         for (String s : config.get("Console/commands").asStringArray().orElse(new String[0])) {
665            ConsoleCommand cc;
666            try {
667               cc = (ConsoleCommand)Class.forName(s).getDeclaredConstructor().newInstance();
668               consoleCommandMap.put(cc.getName(), cc);
669            } catch (Exception e) {
670               getConsoleWriter().println("Could not create console command '"+s+"', " + e.getLocalizedMessage());
671            }
672         }
673         consoleThread = new Thread("ConsoleThread") {
674            @Override /* Thread */
675            public void run() {
676               Scanner in = getConsoleReader();
677               PrintWriter out = getConsoleWriter();
678
679               out.println(messages.getString("ListOfAvailableCommands"));
680               for (ConsoleCommand cc : new TreeMap<>(getConsoleCommands()).values())
681                  out.append("\t").append(cc.getName()).append(" -- ").append(cc.getInfo()).println();
682               out.println();
683
684               while (true) {
685                  String line = null;
686                  out.append("> ").flush();
687                  line = in.nextLine();
688                  Args args = new Args(line);
689                  if (! args.isEmpty())
690                     executeCommand(args, in, out);
691               }
692            }
693         };
694         consoleThread.setDaemon(true);
695      } else {
696         this.consoleReader = null;
697         this.consoleWriter = null;
698         this.consoleThread = null;
699      }
700
701      //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
702      // Other
703      //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
704      this.listener = builder.listener != null ? builder.listener : new BasicMicroserviceListener();
705
706      init();
707   }
708
709   private List<String> getCandidateConfigNames() {
710      if (configName != null)
711         return Collections.singletonList(configName);
712
713      Args args = getArgs();
714      if (getArgs().hasArg("configFile"))
715         return Collections.singletonList(args.getArg("configFile"));
716
717      ManifestFile manifest = getManifest();
718      if (manifest.containsKey("Main-Config"))
719         return Collections.singletonList(manifest.getString("Main-Config"));
720
721      return Config.getCandidateSystemDefaultConfigNames();
722   }
723
724   /**
725    * Resolves the specified path.
726    *
727    * <p>
728    * If the working directory has been explicitly specified, relative paths are resolved relative to that.
729    *
730    * @param path The path to resolve.
731    * @return The resolved path.
732    */
733   protected File resolveFile(String path) {
734      if (Paths.get(path).isAbsolute())
735         return new File(path);
736      if (workingDir != null)
737         return new File(workingDir, path);
738      return new File(path);
739   }
740
741   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
742   // Abstract lifecycle methods.
743   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
744
745   /**
746    * Initializes this microservice.
747    *
748    * <p>
749    * This method can be called whenever the microservice is not started.
750    *
751    * <p>
752    * It will initialize (or reinitialize) the console commands, system properties, and logger.
753    *
754    * @return This object.
755    * @throws ParseException Malformed input encountered.
756    * @throws IOException Couldn't read a file.
757    */
758   public synchronized Microservice init() throws IOException, ParseException {
759
760      // --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
761      // Set system properties.
762      // --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
763      Set<String> spKeys = config.getKeys("SystemProperties");
764      if (spKeys != null)
765         for (String key : spKeys)
766            System.setProperty(key, config.get("SystemProperties/"+key).orElse(null));
767
768      // --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
769      // Initialize logging.
770      // --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
771      this.logger = builder.logger;
772      LogConfig logConfig = builder.logConfig != null ? builder.logConfig : new LogConfig();
773      if (this.logger == null) {
774         LogManager.getLogManager().reset();
775         this.logger = Logger.getLogger("");
776         String logFile = Utils.firstNonNull(logConfig.logFile, config.get("Logging/logFile").orElse(null));
777
778         if (isNotEmpty(logFile)) {
779            String logDir = Utils.firstNonNull(logConfig.logDir, config.get("Logging/logDir").orElse("."));
780            File logDirFile = resolveFile(logDir);
781            mkdirs(logDirFile, false);
782            logDir = logDirFile.getAbsolutePath();
783            System.setProperty("juneau.logDir", logDir);
784
785            boolean append = Utils.firstNonNull(logConfig.append, config.get("Logging/append").asBoolean().orElse(false));
786            int limit = Utils.firstNonNull(logConfig.limit, config.get("Logging/limit").asInteger().orElse(1024*1024));
787            int count = Utils.firstNonNull(logConfig.count, config.get("Logging/count").asInteger().orElse(1));
788
789            FileHandler fh = new FileHandler(logDir + '/' + logFile, limit, count, append);
790
791            Formatter f = logConfig.formatter;
792            if (f == null) {
793               String format = config.get("Logging/format").orElse("[{date} {level}] {msg}%n");
794               String dateFormat = config.get("Logging/dateFormat").orElse("yyyy.MM.dd hh:mm:ss");
795               boolean useStackTraceHashes = config.get("Logging/useStackTraceHashes").asBoolean().orElse(false);
796               f = new LogEntryFormatter(format, dateFormat, useStackTraceHashes);
797            }
798            fh.setFormatter(f);
799            fh.setLevel(Utils.firstNonNull(logConfig.fileLevel, config.get("Logging/fileLevel").as(Level.class).orElse(Level.INFO)));
800            logger.addHandler(fh);
801
802            ConsoleHandler ch = new ConsoleHandler();
803            ch.setLevel(Utils.firstNonNull(logConfig.consoleLevel, config.get("Logging/consoleLevel").as(Level.class).orElse(Level.WARNING)));
804            ch.setFormatter(f);
805            logger.addHandler(ch);
806         }
807      }
808
809      JsonMap loggerLevels = config.get("Logging/levels").as(JsonMap.class).orElseGet(JsonMap::new);
810      for (String l : loggerLevels.keySet())
811         Logger.getLogger(l).setLevel(loggerLevels.get(l, Level.class));
812      for (String l : logConfig.levels.keySet())
813         Logger.getLogger(l).setLevel(logConfig.levels.get(l));
814
815      return this;
816   }
817
818   /**
819    * Start this application.
820    *
821    * <p>
822    * Overridden methods MUST call this method FIRST so that the {@link MicroserviceListener#onStart(Microservice)} method is called.
823    *
824    * @return This object.
825    * @throws Exception Error occurred.
826    */
827   public synchronized Microservice start() throws Exception {
828
829      if (config.getName() == null)
830         err(messages, "RunningClassWithoutConfig", getClass().getSimpleName());
831      else
832         out(messages, "RunningClassWithConfig", getClass().getSimpleName(), config.getName());
833
834      Runtime.getRuntime().addShutdownHook(
835         new Thread("ShutdownHookThread") {
836            @Override /* Thread */
837            public void run() {
838               try {
839                  Microservice.this.stop();
840                  Microservice.this.stopConsole();
841               } catch (Exception e) {
842                  e.printStackTrace();
843               }
844            }
845         }
846      );
847
848      listener.onStart(this);
849
850      return this;
851   }
852
853   /**
854    * Starts the console thread for this microservice.
855    *
856    * @return This object.
857    * @throws Exception Error occurred
858    */
859   public synchronized Microservice startConsole() throws Exception {
860      if (consoleThread != null && ! consoleThread.isAlive())
861         consoleThread.start();
862      return this;
863   }
864
865   /**
866    * Stops the console thread for this microservice.
867    *
868    * @return This object.
869    * @throws Exception Error occurred
870    */
871   public synchronized Microservice stopConsole() throws Exception {
872      if (consoleThread != null && consoleThread.isAlive())
873         consoleThread.interrupt();
874      return this;
875   }
876
877   /**
878    * Returns the command-line arguments passed into the application.
879    *
880    * <p>
881    * This method can be called from the class constructor.
882    *
883    * <p>
884    * See {@link Args} for details on using this method.
885    *
886    * @return The command-line arguments passed into the application.
887    */
888   public Args getArgs() {
889      return args;
890   }
891
892   /**
893    * Returns the external INI-style configuration file that can be used to configure your microservice.
894    *
895    * <p>
896    * The config location is determined in the following order:
897    * <ol class='spaced-list'>
898    *    <li>
899    *       The first argument passed to the microservice jar.
900    *    <li>
901    *       The <c>Main-Config</c> entry in the microservice jar manifest file.
902    *    <li>
903    *       The name of the microservice jar with a <js>".cfg"</js> suffix (e.g.
904    *       <js>"mymicroservice.jar"</js>-&gt;<js>"mymicroservice.cfg"</js>).
905    * </ol>
906    *
907    * <p>
908    * If all methods for locating the config fail, then this method returns an empty config.
909    *
910    * <p>
911    * Subclasses can set their own config file by using the following methods:
912    * <ul class='javatree'>
913    *    <li class='jm'>{@link Builder#configStore(ConfigStore)}
914    *    <li class='jm'>{@link Builder#configName(String)}
915    * </ul>
916    *
917    * <p>
918    * String variables are automatically resolved using the variable resolver returned by {@link #getVarResolver()}.
919    *
920    * <p>
921    * This method can be called from the class constructor.
922    *
923    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
924    * <p class='bini'>
925    *    <cc>#--------------------------</cc>
926    *    <cc># My section</cc>
927    *    <cc>#--------------------------</cc>
928    *    <cs>[MySection]</cs>
929    *
930    *    <cc># An integer</cc>
931    *    <ck>anInt</ck> = 1
932    *
933    *    <cc># A boolean</cc>
934    *    <ck>aBoolean</ck> = true
935    *
936    *    <cc># An int array</cc>
937    *    <ck>anIntArray</ck> = 1,2,3
938    *
939    *    <cc># A POJO that can be converted from a String</cc>
940    *    <ck>aURL</ck> = http://foo
941    *
942    *    <cc># A POJO that can be converted from JSON</cc>
943    *    <ck>aBean</ck> = {foo:'bar',baz:123}
944    *
945    *    <cc># A system property</cc>
946    *    <ck>locale</ck> = $S{java.locale, en_US}
947    *
948    *    <cc># An environment variable</cc>
949    *    <ck>path</ck> = $E{PATH, unknown}
950    *
951    *    <cc># A manifest file entry</cc>
952    *    <ck>mainClass</ck> = $MF{Main-Class}
953    *
954    *    <cc># Another value in this config file</cc>
955    *    <ck>sameAsAnInt</ck> = $C{MySection/anInt}
956    *
957    *    <cc># A command-line argument in the form "myarg=foo"</cc>
958    *    <ck>myArg</ck> = $A{myarg}
959    *
960    *    <cc># The first command-line argument</cc>
961    *    <ck>firstArg</ck> = $A{0}
962    *
963    *    <cc># Look for system property, or env var if that doesn't exist, or command-line arg if that doesn't exist.</cc>
964    *    <ck>nested</ck> = $S{mySystemProperty,$E{MY_ENV_VAR,$A{0}}}
965    *
966    *    <cc># A POJO with embedded variables</cc>
967    *    <ck>aBean2</ck> = {foo:'$A{0}',baz:$C{MySection/anInt}}
968    * </p>
969    *
970    * <p class='bjava'>
971    *    <jc>// Java code for accessing config entries above.</jc>
972    *    Config <jv>config</jv> = getConfig();
973    *
974    *    <jk>int</jk> <jv>anInt</jv> = <jv>config</jv>.get(<js>"MySection/anInt"</js>).asInteger().orElse(-1);
975    *    <jk>boolean</jk> <jv>aBoolean</jv> = <jv>config</jv>.get(<js>"MySection/aBoolean"</js>).asBoolean().orElse(<jk>false</jk>);
976    *    <jk>int</jk>[] <jv>anIntArray</jv> = <jv>config</jv>.get(<js>"MySection/anIntArray"</js>).as(<jk>int</jk>[].<jk>class</jk>).orElse(<jk>null</jk>);
977    *    URL <jv>aURL</jv> = <jv>config</jv>.get(<js>"MySection/aURL"</js>).as(URL.<jk>class</jk>).orElse(<jk>null</jk>);
978    *    MyBean <jv>aBean</jv> = <jv>config</jv>.get(<js>"MySection/aBean"</js>).as(MyBean.<jk>class</jk>).orElse(<jk>null</jk>);
979    *    Locale <jv>locale</jv> = <jv>config</jv>.get(<js>"MySection/locale"</js>).as(Locale.<jk>class</jk>).orElse(<jk>null</jk>);
980    *    String <jv>path</jv> = <jv>config</jv>.get(<js>"MySection/path"</js>).orElse(<jk>null</jk>);
981    *    String <jv>mainClass</jv> = <jv>config</jv>.get(<js>"MySection/mainClass"</js>).orElse(<jk>null</jk>);
982    *    <jk>int</jk> <jv>sameAsAnInt</jv> = <jv>config</jv>.get(<js>"MySection/sameAsAnInt"</js>).asInteger().orElse(<jk>null</jk>);
983    *    String <jv>myArg</jv> = <jv>config</jv>.getString(<js>"MySection/myArg"</js>);
984    *    String <jv>firstArg</jv> = <jv>config</jv>.getString(<js>"MySection/firstArg"</js>);
985    * </p>
986    *
987    * @return The config file for this application, or <jk>null</jk> if no config file is configured.
988    */
989   public Config getConfig() {
990      return config;
991   }
992
993   /**
994    * Returns the main jar manifest file contents as a simple {@link JsonMap}.
995    *
996    * <p>
997    * This map consists of the contents of {@link Manifest#getMainAttributes()} with the keys and entries converted to
998    * simple strings.
999    * <p>
1000    * This method can be called from the class constructor.
1001    *
1002    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
1003    * <p class='bjava'>
1004    *    <jc>// Get Main-Class from manifest file.</jc>
1005    *    String <jv>mainClass</jv> = Microservice.<jsm>getManifest</jsm>().getString(<js>"Main-Class"</js>, <js>"unknown"</js>);
1006    *
1007    *    <jc>// Get Rest-Resources from manifest file.</jc>
1008    *    String[] <jv>restResources</jv> = Microservice.<jsm>getManifest</jsm>().getStringArray(<js>"Rest-Resources"</js>);
1009    * </p>
1010    *
1011    * @return The manifest file from the main jar, or <jk>null</jk> if the manifest file could not be retrieved.
1012    */
1013   public ManifestFile getManifest() {
1014      return manifest;
1015   }
1016
1017   /**
1018    * Returns the variable resolver for resolving variables in strings and files.
1019    *
1020    * <p>
1021    * Variables can be controlled by the following methods:
1022    * <ul class='javatree'>
1023    *    <li class='jm'>{@link Builder#vars(Class...)}
1024    *    <li class='jm'>{@link Builder#varBean(Class,Object)}
1025    * </ul>
1026    *
1027    * @return The VarResolver used by this Microservice, or <jk>null</jk> if it was never created.
1028    */
1029   public VarResolver getVarResolver() {
1030      return varResolver;
1031   }
1032
1033   /**
1034    * Returns the logger for this microservice.
1035    *
1036    * @return The logger for this microservice.
1037    */
1038   public Logger getLogger() {
1039      return logger;
1040   }
1041
1042   /**
1043    * Executes a console command.
1044    *
1045    * @param args
1046    *    The command arguments.
1047    *    <br>The first entry in the arguments is always the command name.
1048    * @param in Console input.
1049    * @param out Console output.
1050    * @return <jk>true</jk> if the command returned <jk>true</jk> meaning the console thread should exit.
1051    */
1052   public boolean executeCommand(Args args, Scanner in, PrintWriter out) {
1053      ConsoleCommand cc = consoleCommandMap.get(args.getArg(0));
1054      if (cc == null) {
1055         out.println(messages.getString("UnknownCommand"));
1056      } else {
1057         try {
1058            return cc.execute(in, out, args);
1059         } catch (Exception e) {
1060            e.printStackTrace(out);
1061         }
1062      }
1063      return false;
1064   }
1065
1066   /**
1067    * Convenience method for executing a console command directly.
1068    *
1069    * <p>
1070    * Allows you to execute a console command outside the console by simulating input and output.
1071    *
1072    * @param command The command name to execute.
1073    * @param input Optional input to the command.  Can be <jk>null</jk>.
1074    * @param args Optional command arguments to pass to the command.
1075    * @return The command output.
1076    */
1077   public String executeCommand(String command, String input, Object...args) {
1078      StringWriter sw = new StringWriter();
1079      List<String> l = list();
1080      l.add(command);
1081      for (Object a : args)
1082         l.add(Utils.s(a));
1083      Args args2 = new Args(l.toArray(new String[l.size()]));
1084      try (Scanner in = new Scanner(input); PrintWriter out = new PrintWriter(sw)) {
1085         executeCommand(args2, in, out);
1086      }
1087      return sw.toString();
1088   }
1089
1090   /**
1091    * Joins the application with the current thread.
1092    *
1093    * <p>
1094    * Default implementation is a no-op.
1095    *
1096    * @return This object.
1097    * @throws Exception Error occurred
1098    */
1099   public Microservice join() throws Exception {
1100      return this;
1101   }

1103   /**
1104    * Stop this application.
1105    *
1106    * <p>
1107    * Overridden methods MUST call this method LAST so that the {@link MicroserviceListener#onStop(Microservice)} method is called.
1108    *
1109    * @return This object.
1110    * @throws Exception Error occurred
1111    */
1112   public Microservice stop() throws Exception {
1113      listener.onStop(this);
1114      return this;
1115   }
1116
1117   /**
1118    * Stops the console (if it's started) and calls {@link System#exit(int)}.
1119    *
1120    * @throws Exception Error occurred
1121    */
1122   public void exit() throws Exception {
1123      try {
1124         stopConsole();
1125      } catch (Exception e) {
1126         e.printStackTrace();
1127      }
1128      System.exit(0);
1129   }
1130
1131   /**
1132    * Kill the JVM by calling <c>System.exit(2);</c>.
1133    */
1134   public void kill() {
1135      // This triggers the shutdown hook.
1136      System.exit(2);
1137   }

1144   /**
1145    * Returns the console commands associated with this microservice.
1146    *
1147    * @return The console commands associated with this microservice as an unmodifiable map.
1148    */
1149   public final Map<String,ConsoleCommand> getConsoleCommands() {
1150      return consoleCommandMap;
1151   }

1153   /**
1154    * Returns the console reader.
1155    *
1156    * <p>
1157    * Subclasses can override this method to provide their own console input.
1158    *
1159    * @return The console reader.  Never <jk>null</jk>.
1160    */
1161   protected Scanner getConsoleReader() {
1162      return consoleReader;
1163   }
1164
1165   /**
1166    * Returns the console writer.
1167    *
1168    * <p>
1169    * Subclasses can override this method to provide their own console output.
1170    *
1171    * @return The console writer.  Never <jk>null</jk>.
1172    */
1173   protected PrintWriter getConsoleWriter() {
1174      return consoleWriter;
1175   }
1176
1177   /**
1178    * Prints a localized message to the console writer.
1179    *
1180    * <p>
1181    * Ignored if <js>"Console/enabled"</js> is <jk>false</jk>.
1182    *
1183    * @param mb The message bundle containing the message.
1184    * @param messageKey The message key.
1185    * @param args Optional {@link MessageFormat}-style arguments.
1186    */
1187   public void out(Messages mb, String messageKey, Object...args) {
1188      String msg = mb.getString(messageKey, args);
1189      if (consoleEnabled)
1190         getConsoleWriter().println(msg);
1191      log(Level.INFO, msg);
1192   }
1193
1194   /**
1195    * Prints a localized message to STDERR.
1196    *
1197    * <p>
1198    * Ignored if <js>"Console/enabled"</js> is <jk>false</jk>.
1199    *
1200    * @param mb The message bundle containing the message.
1201    * @param messageKey The message key.
1202    * @param args Optional {@link MessageFormat}-style arguments.
1203    */
1204   public void err(Messages mb, String messageKey, Object...args) {
1205      String msg = mb.getString(messageKey, args);
1206      if (consoleEnabled)
1207         System.err.println(mb.getString(messageKey, args));  // NOT DEBUG
1208      log(Level.SEVERE, msg);
1209   }
1210
1211   /**
1212    * Logs a message to the log file.
1213    *
1214    * @param level The log level.
1215    * @param message The message text.
1216    * @param args Optional {@link MessageFormat}-style arguments.
1217    */
1218   protected void log(Level level, String message, Object...args) {
1219      String msg = args.length == 0 ? message : MessageFormat.format(message, args);
1220      getLogger().log(level, msg);
1221   }
1222
1223   @Override /* ConfigChangeListener */
1224   public void onConfigChange(ConfigEvents events) {
1225      listener.onConfigChange(this, events);
1226   }
1227}
